page.title: 04Forestry
page.content: The landscape of the east of the block is dominated by coniferous woodland. The Forestry Commission manages the ecology of Tintern, Ninewells,Creigiou and Broadmend woods. The main tree are Sitka Spruce, Scots Pine and Corsican Pine.Other species are Japanese Larch, Norway Spruce, Western Red Cedar and Lodge Pole Pine. The main planting in the area was between 1924 and 1954. Further planting took place in 1975,'76,'81,and is still going on.The soil is poor being on quartz conglo_ merate.Near Cleddon Bog tree's are planted on mound's to help drainage around the roots. Japanese Larch are planted as fire breaks.In 1981 a grass fire at Cleddon Bog scorched the Larch but spread no further. Water tanks, ponds and beaters are sited to fight fires.
